section: The Term of this Agreement shall be for a period of [* ****] years and [*****] months commencing the 1st day of September 2004 and terminating the [*****] day of [*****].
explanation: The contract provides a start date but redacts the number of years and months in the term of the agreement, as well as the exact termination date. This is an omission that creates an in-text contradiction. The agreement attempts to define a fixed term but fails to provide sufficient details to determine the full duration, which is an essential element of the agreement.

section: MANDATORY PRODUCTS' shall mean the following ADAMS GOLF PRODUCTS that CONSULTANT must exclusively play/use in all Champions/Senior Professional Golf Association (SPGA) and Professional Golf Association (PGA) events at all times: [***** ] Confidential Material redacted and filed separately with the Commission.
explanation: The agreement requires the Consultant to exclusively use 'mandatory products', yet the details of what constitutes these mandatory products is redacted. This is an example of an omission in text because it indicates an important part of the agreement but the agreement does not define it. This leads to a contradiction, as it is impossible to know what the consultant is obliged to use and could cause legal disputes.

section: In each and every calendar year of this Agreement, CONSULTANT shall achieve a satisfactory record of play in a minimum of [* ****] professional golf association events on the SPGA and/or PGA tour (which shall include both the PGA and SPGA Tour Skins Games). If for any reason, CONSULTANT should achieve a satisfactory record of play in less than [*****] SPGA and/or PGA tour events in a calendar year, he shall repay ADAMS GOLF an amount per event for each event under [*****] achieved in the given calendar year as follows:
explanation: The contract requires the consultant to partake in a 'minimum' number of SPGA/PGA events, and the number of events is redacted. The amount he must repay if he does not achieve a satisfactory record of play is also redacted. This is an example of an omission in text because it indicates an important part of the agreement but the agreement does not define it, which leads to a contradiction. This could lead to confusion over what his obligations are and what he would be required to pay.
